0: Please enable Javascript to watch this video NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR SALT LAKE COUNTY, Utah — It was a case of being at the right place at the right time for a Unified Fire crew who helped to save a woman being strangled in an underpass along Interstate 80 near Parley’s Canyon Friday night. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I would say it's pretty heroic even though we don't like to use those terms, these guys stepped in when they didn't have to, and made a massive impact on someone's life," said Eric Holmes, spokesman for Unified Fire Authority. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Unified Fire crew just happened to be driving underneath the 1-80 eastbound overpass, at exit 131, returning from a grass fire, when they saw a car sitting in the middle of the tunnel. A man was outside the vehicle, assaulting a woman with a rope. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Fire authorities saw the female with the rope wrapped around her neck and he was in the process of trying to hoist her up and strangle her,” said Sgt. Randy Riches, of the Utah Department of Public Safety. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR When the suspect, 22-year-old Juan Echevesta, saw the firefighters he tried to force the woman into the passenger seat. The four firefighters knew they didn't have time to call police. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "They felt if they were to allow the vehicle to travel down the road with her in it that her life would come to an end very shortly,” Riches said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR So the first responders did what they do best, they responded. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Firefighters were in fear that her life was in danger so they quickly rushed the car and restrained the male driver,” Riches said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Department of Public Safety says the firefighters acted on instinct and that was enough to save this woman's life. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Not something they are trained to do, it's not something they practice in, but they have that instinct in them because they are first responders and they sign up for the job for a reason,” Riches said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Echevesta is facing charges of attempted murder and aggravated kidnapping. The Department of Public Safety said that the victim and suspect know each other but they wouldn't go into detail regarding the nature of that relationship.
